subject: Entrepreneurship
subcategory: Business Models That Changed the World
title: The Aggregator Theory
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Aggregator Theory.

hook.text: Google doesn't create content. Facebook doesn't write posts. Yet they captured all the ad revenue.

buildup.text: Ben Thompson's Aggregation Theory explains how the internet lets certain companies dominate industries.

discovery.text: Aggregators win by owning the customer relationship. Suppliers become interchangeable and commoditized.

twist.text: Hotels compete for your booking on Expedia. Expedia doesn't competeâ€”it just takes a cut from everyone.

climax.text: The aggregator sits between supply and demand, capturing value from both sides without creating either.

punchline.text: Own the customer. Let everyone else fight for scraps.

quiz.question: What is the key power of an aggregator according to Aggregation Theory?
options: Producing the best content or products in the market
Owning the customer relationship while commoditizing suppliers
Offering the lowest prices by eliminating all middlemen
